project.name: Fatiando a Terra
project.description: Fatiando a Terra is a community-driven project aimed to provide open-source Python tools for Geosciences. It was born in South America as part of the PhD Thesis of its creators. In time, a community of international users and contributors grew around it. Fatiando characterizes for its well designed and tested software, along with a comprehensive documentation. Its developers and contributors rely on best-practices to provide high quality software that many researchers and practitioners use for their research and work. The project members are committed to create a more open and reproducible science, developing the foundational tools to perform geoscientific research, and improving the ways researchers from different regions of the world collaborate.

applicant.name: Santiago Soler
applicant.role: Member of the Steering Council and Maintainer
